This class deserialized fine in 2.5.3 but fails in 2.6 with conflicting setter definitions for setProtocol.

https://t.co/qEXz8VyWBL

Is the change intentional?

issue.title: Create a way to let custom code (or modules) resolve accessor conflicts

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body:
Currently existence of multiple accessors of same type (getter, setter, constructor parameter, field) for a single property will throw an exception. This is needed because databinder is unable to determine which of alternatives should be used for serialization/deserialization.

But just because core databind does not know which way to go does not mean that application level code could not choose one over another; or, in some cases, modules: Scala module for example may be able to determine that one of two is a synthetic accessor that may be ignored.

To allow for extending things in this way there needs to be a new pluggable abstraction that will be invoked in case of suspected conflict. Registered handlers may then be called to give them a chance to resolve the conflict by indicating that one of the choices should be used, and the other ignored.
This process can then be used to resolve any number of potentially conflicting accessors.
